component-types.description: This connector component invokes HTTP endpoints (tyically REST enpoints) and sets the result to the connector data. This connector can be used as data source for other components.
This connector component binds its data to a cookie. This connector can be used as data source for other components.

This connector component makes its data persistent by serializing it into the Local Storage of the current browser, in the given key. It also provides synchronization capabilities so that the data can be available accros several devices and shared between several users. This connector can be used as data source for other components.

A data mapper is a component that maps the data of a source component to its own data, applying some transformation(s) to it (typically filter/map/reduce). This connector can be used as data source for other components.

This connector component uses the geolocation API to provide the current user's location in its data. It also support connection to the Nominatim geocoding API, to resolve postal adresses as latitude/longitude coordinates.
This component displays a text to the user, with several formatting option available. The text can include HTML elements.
This component defines a user input for a true or false value, and displayed as a checkbox or a switch.
This component defines a user input to select one or multiple values within a list of data.
This component defines a user input for sereval kinds of data.
This component is a text area form input, for multiple-line text.
This component displays a button with a text and an optional icon and can execute actions when clicked.
This component displays an image located at a given URL.
This component displays a builtin icon from its name.
This component contains other components and can be used to layout them in different ways.

A reference component allows to insert another component in place of the reference. Several references can refer to the same component, making it convenient to factorize a component and repeat it in serveral places of your application.
This component splits the parent container in 2 parts. The split can be horizontal or vertical. It also provides support for resizable split and default sizes.
This component also showing information (title, body, image, ...) in a so-called card.
This component loops over an array of data in the data source, and repeats a content passing the currently iterated data.
Create a widget of tabbable containes, allowing the user to interactively switch between different containers by clicking on the tabs.
Easily toggle visibility of almost any content on your pages in a vertically collapsing container.
Dialogs are used to popup or prompt information to the user. The dialog content may contain any component.
This component displays tabular data. It supports pagination, filtering, sorting, custom cell components, and various style options.
This component displays various types of charts (line charts, bar charts, pie charts, radar charts). It is a wrapper of the well-known ChartJS library.
This component is a specific chart that is made to display time series data.
Lightweight custom tagged input form control, with options for customized interface rendering, duplicate tag detection and optional tag validation.
The Popover feature, provides a tooltip-like behavior, with fully customizable container content.
BootstrapVue custom date picker input form control.
BootstrapVue custom time picker input form control,
Quick first, previous, next, last, and page buttons for pagination control of an iterable component (a table or an iterator).
Avatar components are typically used to display a user profile as a picture, an icon, or short text.
A component to embed media content (video, audio, image), or external web sites.
A component to embed a map. It supports the Leaflet and OpenStreetMap API.
The carousel is a slideshow for cycling through a series of content. It works with a series of images, text, or custom markup. It also includes support for previous/next controls and indicators.
A custom progress component for displaying simple or complex progress bars, featuring support for horizontally stacked bars, animated backgrounds, and text labels.
The main navbar component for the application. Contains menus, custom components, user management support, route management support, and various global functions for the application.

HttpConnector.description: A function to handle http errors: (errorStatus, url, initializationObject) => { ... }
Select the type of result expected when invoking the endpoint (default is JSON, parsed to an object)
If unspecified, defaults to comma (English standard)
Use a proxy (to be used to allow CORS when accessing REST APIs)
Cache the invocation results in the local storage when possible
The number of minutes before a cache key expires (when not defined, default is 24 hours)

The maximum number of entries in the cache (each entry corresponds to a set of specific parameter values), default is 100. Note that cache eviction takes place when the number of entries reaches the max number of entries and frees 10% of the cache.
LRU: Least Recently Used, LFU: Least Frequently Used

The path to the http endpoint. When using the invoke(...params) action on this component, you can access invocation parameters with the this.invokeParams variable (for instance: x/y/${this.invokeParams[0]}/z)
Sends the body as a form data instead of serialized JSON (default)
Specifies how the body should be sent (default is serialized JSON). FORM-DATA sends the body as form data. TEXT sends the body as is.
A JSON object containing the headers to be added to the request.

An object containing the body of the request. However, when the selected body type is raw-text, you should write a formula that evaluates to a string. When using the invoke(...params) action on this component, you can access invocation parameters with the this.invokeParams variable (for instance: { key: ${this.invokeParams[0]} })

CookieConnector.description: A string representing the name of the cookie. If omitted, this is empty by default.
The default value of the data model when the cookie does not exist yet or when its value is not valid.
A date or a number that represents the expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. If omitted, the cookie becomes a session cookie.
A cookies.SameSiteStatus value that indicates the SameSite state of the cookie. If omitted, it defaults to no_restriction.

LocalStorageConnector.description: If set, this connector is a query to the local storage (read-only data access). Keys and shared by expressions can be regexp to match existing storage keys - when several keys are matched, the data is merged into a unique collection.
If set, this connector automatically synchronizes before and after each data change.
If set, this connector automatically injects IDs to the data objects.
If set, this connector automatically injects timestamps to the data objects.
If set, the data is persited in the application model.
A string representing key used to store the data in the local storage
A user ID - the given user must share the key with you to have access
A list of user ids to share this data with (read/write permissions). For partitioned data, can be a function returning a list of user ids: (id, data) => ...
A list of user ids to share this data with (read-only permission). For partitioned data, can be a function returning a list of user ids: (id, data) => ...
If a partition key is defined, the data, which is an array, will be partitioned in several sub-keys (main-key::partition-key), which can be shared and synchronized independently
If set, the storage is only remote (on the server) and no data is stored locally in the browser - the user must be authenticated
The default value of the data model when the data does not exist yet in the local storage or when its value is not valid

DataMapper.description: A functional expression that maps (transforms, filters, sorts, reduces, ...) the data from the data source to the data model. For instance: data => data.filter(d => d.category === "c")

GeolocConnector.description: A boolean value that indicates the application would like to receive the best possible results. If true and if the device is able to provide a more accurate position, it will do so. Note that this can result in slower response times or increased power consumption (with a GPS chip on a mobile device for example). On the other hand, if false, the device can take the liberty to save resources by responding more quickly and/or using less power. Default: false.

A positive long value representing the maximum length of time (in milliseconds) the device is allowed to take in order to return a position. The default value is Infinity, meaning that getCurrentPosition() won't return until the position is available.

A positive long value indicating the maximum age in milliseconds of a possible cached position that is acceptable to return. If set to 0, it means that the device cannot use a cached position and must attempt to retrieve the real current position. If set to Infinity the device must return a cached position regardless of its age. Default: 0.

TextView.description: The wrapping element being used - default is "Block"
Max number of text columns. The actual number depends on the column width if defined.
A minimum width for the text columns (as a CSS width)
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

CheckboxView.description: When placed in a form container, the value must be defined when submitting the form
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

SelectView.description: A list of strings or objects containing value and text properties (or html to use with caution for formatted text)
When checked, an information button will be added to open a popup with the description inside
When checked, the user can clear the selection (for dropdown)
Size for the choices (xl is usually for mobile)
When dropdown shows as a sidebar, it will not overlap the navbar
When set, renders a split button dropdown
The class applyied to the dropdown menu content (including when showing as sidebar). If not defined, defaults to container
When set, the dropdown menu does not show the default choices, but only the custom component if any
Shows a custom/editable header in the dropdown (instead of the default one if any)
Shows a custom/editable footer in the dropdown
Shows the dropdown menu as a sidebar when the screen size is smaller than the given breakpoint
Number of columns for the label when horizontal layout (0 or undefined is auto)
A text to display in the select when no value is selected
If set, allows multiple selection (the data model is an array)
When placed in a form container, the value must be defined when submitting the form
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

InputView.description: Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
An input mask. For instance: ##:##. #: Number (0-9), A: Letter in any case (a-z,A-Z), N: Number or letter (a-z,A-Z,0-9), X: Any symbol, ? Optional (next character)
If off, the browser will not fill the value automatically with previously saved values (default is on)
Allow the user to upload a file and set this URL field with an encoded file value
Default is 1024KB (= 1MB)
Select a camera connector (create one if needed) in order to allow the user to fill this URL field with an encoded picture taken with the current device's camera
Show the URL with data preview and do not show the input with the encoded data
Shows a default image when the image URL is not defined
Use a proxy to access the file
Cache files in the proxy and get files from the proxy cache (warning: no effects if caching is not enabled for the proxy)
A hint for the compression quality (if proxy has compression enabled)
A hint for resizing width (if resizing is supported for media file), in pixels
A hint for resizing width (if resizing is supported for media file), in pixels
When checked, the accessed file is the raw (original) content (warning: no effects if compression is not enabled for the proxy)
Allow the user to download URL as a local file
Allow the user to delete the URL data
A file name to use when downloading the file
CSS class(es) to apply to the file preview (case of a URL input type with a preview)
CSS style to apply to the file preview (case of a URL input type with a preview)
CSS class(es) to apply when the input is not showing (the input shows only when the user clicks)
CSS style to apply when the input is not showing (the input shows only when the user clicks)
A function that formats the value that is shown when showInputOnClick is selected and the input is not active.
A value evaluating to true is required for this control to have a valid state
A list of suggestions (string values) to show to the user when typing in
Number of columns for the label when horizontal layout
Class(es) (space-separated) applying to the label
When checked, an information button will be added to open a popup with the description inside

possibleValues.text: "symbol" to use a localized currency symbol such as €, this is the default value
"narrowSymbol" to use a narrow format symbol ("$100" rather than "US$100")
"code" to use the ISO currency code
"name" to use a localized currency name such as "dollar"

InputView.description: In many locales, accounting format means to wrap the number with parentheses instead of appending a minus sign. Check this to enable this formatting.

possibleValues.text: "engineering" - exponent of ten when divisible by three
"compact" - string representing exponent; defaults to using the "short" form
"auto" sign display for negative numbers only
"exceptZero" sign display for positive and negative numbers, but not zero
"negative" sign display for negative numbers only, excluding negative zero.
"always": display grouping separators even if the locale prefers otherwise
"auto": display grouping separators based on the locale preference, which may also be dependent on the currency
"min2": display grouping separators when there are at least 2 digits in a group
"halfEven": ties toward the value with even cardinality

InputView.description: The minimum number of integer digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 1.

The minimum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number and percent formatting is 0; the default for currency formatting is the number of minor unit digits provided by the ISO 4217 currency code list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information).

The maximum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are from 0 to 20; the default for plain number formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and 3; the default for currency formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and the number of minor unit digits provided by the ISO 4217 currency code list (2 if the list doesn't provide that information); the default for percent formatting is the larger of minimumFractionDigits and 0.
The minimum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 1.
The maximum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are from 1 to 21; the default is 21.
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

TextareaView.description: Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
Number of columns for the label when horizontal layout
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

ButtonView.description: When the button is in a form (see parent containter), select the button type to trigger a submit or reset event in the form
A text that shows as a popover when hovering the button

cylon: slides the icon left-right, cylon-vertical: slides the icon up-down, fade: fades the icon in and out, spin: smoothly spins the icon clockwise, spin-reverse: smoothly spins the icon counter-clockwise, spin-pulse: spins the icon clockwise, but in a pulsed step style, spin-reverse-pulse: spins the icon counter-clockwise, but in a pulsed step style, throb: scales the icon in and out
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

ImageView.description: A URL or formula evaluating to a URL that will override the data model (if not defined, the data model is expected to contain an image URL)
Use a proxy to access the image
Cache images in the proxy and get images from the proxy cache (warning: no effects if caching is not enabled for the proxy)
A hint for the compression quality (if proxy has compression enabled)
A hint for resizing width, in pixels
A hint for resizing width, in pixels
When checked, the accessed image is the raw (uncompressed) content (warning: no effects if compression is not enabled for the proxy)
When defined, wraps this image into a link
Shows a default image when the image URL is not defined
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

IconView.description: Use the data model of this component to determine the icon dynamically
Allow the user to interactively select a new icon and sets the data with it

cylon: slides the icon left-right, cylon-vertical: slides the icon up-down, fade: fades the icon in and out, spin: smoothly spins the icon clockwise, spin-reverse: smoothly spins the icon counter-clockwise, spin-pulse: spins the icon clockwise, but in a pulsed step style, spin-reverse-pulse: spins the icon counter-clockwise, but in a pulsed step style, throb: scales the icon in and out
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

ContainerView.description: Makes this container a stepper, meaning that each component will be shown individually and that you can use the next(), previous(), and goto(index) actions to navigate within the components.
Transition animations for the stepper.
The duration of the transition animations for the stepper (in ms).

CSS classes to apply to the items of this container. This fomula can be a function taking the item index, col, and row arguments for a grid layout, for example: (index, row, col) => row === 0 ? "text-bold" : undefined

CSS to apply to the items of this container. This fomula can be a function taking the item index, col, and row arguments for a grid layout, for example: (index, row, col) => row === 0 ? "font-size: 0.8rem" : undefined
A size for the background image (default is cover)
A minimum width for the columns (as a CSS width)
Sets the initial position of the background image (default is center)
An image to be used for the background of this container. Can be a css gradient, e.g.: linear-gradient(red, blue 10%)
An opacity factor to apply to the background variant (if background variant is defined)
If enabled, this container acts as a form and reacts on @submit and @reset events
If enabled, all contained controls show their state as soon as the user inputs a new value
When set, enables browser native HTML5 validation on controls in the form
Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
Default is no-padding - other values correspond to the boostrap classes (see the doc)

Default is flex. For left-to-right items layout and fixed number of columns, use the grid kind. For top-down items layout, use the column kind. Use list-group to place the items into a vertical list group
Listen to keyboard events.
Tells how to align the items of this container when the flex layout kind is selected. Default is column.

Tells the wrap behavior when the components overflow the flex container width.
  • nowrap (default): all flex items will be on one line.
  • wrap: flex items will wrap onto multiple lines, from top to bottom.
  • wrap-reverse: flex items will wrap onto multiple lines from bottom to top.

This defines the flex container alignment along the main axis. It helps distribute extra free space leftover when either all the flex items on a line are inflexible, or are flexible but have reached their maximum size. It also exerts some control over the alignment of items when they overflow the line.
  • start (default): items are packed toward the start of the flex direction.
  • end: items are packed toward the end of the flex direction.
  • start: items are packed toward the start of the writing-mode direction.
  • center: items are centered along the line
  • space-between: items are evenly distributed in the line; first item is on the start line, last item on the end line
  • space-around: items are evenly distributed in the line with equal space around them. Note that visually the spaces aren’t equal, since all the items have equal space on both sides. The first item will have one unit of space against the container edge, but two units of space between the next item because that next item has its own spacing that applies.
  • space-evenly: items are distributed so that the spacing between any two items (and the space to the edges) is equal.

This defines the default behavior for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis on the current line.
  • stretch (default): stretch to fill the container (still respect min-width/max-width)
  • start: items are placed at the start of the cross axis. The difference between these is subtle, and is about respecting the flex-direction rules or the writing-mode rules.
  • end: items are placed at the end of the cross axis. The difference again is subtle and is about respecting flex-direction rules vs. writing-mode rules.
  • center: items are centered in the cross-axis
  • baseline: items are aligned such as their baselines align

This aligns a flex container's lines within when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how justify aligns individual items within the main-axis.
  • normal (default): items are packed in their default position as if no value was set.
  • stretch: lines stretch to take up the remaining space
  • start: items packed to the start of the container.
  • end: items packed to the end of the container.
  • center: items centered in the container
  • space-between: items evenly distributed; the first line is at the start of the container while the last one is at the end
  • space-around: items evenly distributed with equal space around each line
  • space-evenly: items are evenly distributed with equal space around them
When checked, all child components inside this container get lazy loaded when appearing on the screen. Note that before they appear, lazy-loaded components cannot be accessed by other components.
A CSS width for this container child components before they get lazy loaded
A CSS height for this container child components before they get lazy loaded
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

ReferenceView.description: Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height

SplitView.description: Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

CardView.description: Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

IteratorView.description: Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
When checked all the items up to the current page will show.
Makes this container a stepper, meaning that each component will be shown individually and that you can use the next(), previous(), and goto(index) actions to navigate within the components.
The duration of the transition animations for the stepper (in ms).
A minimum width for the columns (as a CSS width)
Default is no-padding - other values correspond to the boostrap classes (see the doc)

Default is flex. For left-to-right items layout and fixed number of columns, use the grid kind. For top-down items layout, use the column kind. Use list-group to place the items into a vertical list group
Tells how to align the items of this container when the flex layout kind is selected. Default is column.

Tells the wrap behavior when the components overflow the flex container width.
  • nowrap (default): all flex items will be on one line.
  • wrap: flex items will wrap onto multiple lines, from top to bottom.
  • wrap-reverse: flex items will wrap onto multiple lines from bottom to top.

This defines the flex container alignment along the main axis. It helps distribute extra free space leftover when either all the flex items on a line are inflexible, or are flexible but have reached their maximum size. It also exerts some control over the alignment of items when they overflow the line.
  • start (default): items are packed toward the start of the flex direction.
  • end: items are packed toward the end of the flex direction.
  • start: items are packed toward the start of the writing-mode direction.
  • center: items are centered along the line
  • space-between: items are evenly distributed in the line; first item is on the start line, last item on the end line
  • space-around: items are evenly distributed in the line with equal space around them. Note that visually the spaces aren’t equal, since all the items have equal space on both sides. The first item will have one unit of space against the container edge, but two units of space between the next item because that next item has its own spacing that applies.
  • space-evenly: items are distributed so that the spacing between any two items (and the space to the edges) is equal.

This defines the default behavior for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis on the current line.
  • stretch (default): stretch to fill the container (still respect min-width/max-width)
  • start: items are placed at the start of the cross axis. The difference between these is subtle, and is about respecting the flex-direction rules or the writing-mode rules.
  • end: items are placed at the end of the cross axis. The difference again is subtle and is about respecting flex-direction rules vs. writing-mode rules.
  • center: items are centered in the cross-axis
  • baseline: items are aligned such as their baselines align

This aligns a flex container's lines within when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how justify aligns individual items within the main-axis.
  • normal (default): items are packed in their default position as if no value was set.
  • stretch: lines stretch to take up the remaining space
  • start: items packed to the start of the container.
  • end: items packed to the end of the container.
  • center: items centered in the container
  • space-between: items evenly distributed; the first line is at the start of the container while the last one is at the end
  • space-around: items evenly distributed with equal space around each line
  • space-evenly: items are evenly distributed with equal space around them
When checked, all component items of this iterator get lazy loaded when appearing on the screen. Note that before they appear, lazy-loaded components cannot be accessed by other components.
A CSS width for this iterator items before they are lazy loaded (when appearing on the screen)
A CSS height for this iterator items before they are lazy loaded (when appearing on the screen)
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

TabsView.description: A formula to set the initially selected tab index
A formula to set the tab validation states. For instance, if you have 3 tabs, [true, false, true] will activate the first and second tabs.
Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
Align the nav items in the nav
Remove the layout of tabs within a card
Render the nav items with the appearance of pill buttons
Render the nav items with the appearance of steps
Proportionately fill all horizontal space with nav items. All horizontal space is occupied, but not every nav item has the same width
Fill all horizontal space with nav items, but unlike 'fill', every nav item will be the same width
Place the tab controls at the bottom (horizontal tabs), or right (vertical tabs)
Lazily render the tab contents when shown
When set to `true`, disable the fade animation/transition on the component
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the currently active tab
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the tab-content wrapper
CSS class (or classes) to apply to card wrapper when the card layout is enabled
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

CollapseView.description: The name of the accordion group that this collapse belongs to, if any
When set, and visible is true, will animate on initial display
Sets the initial visibility of the collapse
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

DialogView.description: Enables scrolling of the modal body
Vertically centers the modal in the viewport
Specify the HTML tag to render instead of the default tag for the footer ('footer')
Specify the HTML tag to render instead of the default tag for the header ('header')
Specify the HTML tag to render instead of the default tag ('div')
When checked, disables closing the sidebar when the user clicks on the backdrop. Requires "backdrop" be checked
When checked, disables closing the sidebar when the user presses ESC
When checked, disables closing of the sidebar on route change
Disables the enforce focus routine which maintains focus inside the sidebar
When checked, disables rendering of the default header (including close button)
When checked, disables rendering of the header close button
When checked, disables the default sliding animation
When checked, positions the sidebar on the right of the viewport
When checked, the content of the sidebar will only be rendered while the sidebar is open
When checked, shows a backdrop when the sidebar is open
Configures the sidebar shadow. Default is no shadow
Theme variant color for the backdrop of the sidebar. Defaults to 'dark'
Theme variant color for the background of the sidebar. Defaults to 'light'
Theme variant color for the text of the sidebar. Defaults to 'dark'
Specify an arbitrary z-index value to override the value defined by SCSS/CSS
CSS width for the sidebar. Defaults to '320px' as defined by SCSS/CSS

TableView.description: A data connector component that stores the view model to be used for this table
When set, places the table body rows in not selectable mode
The selectable mode for the table (default: multi).
A function returning the HTML to be rendered in table cells, for example: data => `data.value`
Criteria for filtering. Internal filtering supports only string or RegExpr criteria (otherwise, please use a filter function)

A filter function taking record, filter arguments, where record is the object in the table and filter is the value of the "filter" property - Note that the "filter" property must not be null/false in order for this function to be called
Array of top level fields to ignore when filtering the item data
Array of fields to include when filtering. Overrides filter-ignore-fields
Adds a column that expands the rows to show the details section
Number of items per page

Generate a responsive stacked table. Set to true for an always stacked table, or set it to one of the breakpoints sm, md, lg, or xl to make the table visually stacked only on screens smaller than the breakpoint.
Applies striping to the tbody rows
Renders the table with smaller cell padding
Do not show the table header
Enables hover styling on rows
Adds an outline border to the table element
Adds borders to all the cells and headers
Removes all borders from cells
Places the table in dark mode
HTML string to show when the table has no items to show
HTML string to show when the table has no items to show due to filtering
Makes all columns equal width (fixed layout table). Will speed up rendering for large tables. Column widths can be set via CSS or colgroup
Makes the table responsive in width, adding a horizontal scrollbar. Set to true for always responsive or set to one of the breakpoints to switch from responsive to normal: sm, md, lg, xl
Apply a Bootstrap theme color variant to the tr element in the thead
Classes to be applied to every row on the table. If a function is given, it will be called with (item, type) parameters and it may return an Array, Object or String.
Attributes to be applied to every row on the table. If a function is given, it will be called with (item, type) parameters and it must return an Object.
Classes to be applied to every cell on the table. Can be overridden for each column individually (see the fields section). If no classes is defined, it defaults to align-middle.
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

ChartView.description: Some JavaScript code for custom initialization of the chart.js options - for example: chartOptions.options.scales.x.ticks = { ... }
The user can edit the data by dragging the dots
If checked, the given min value can be overridden by the actual min value in the data
If checked, the given max value can be overridden by the actual max value in the data
Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
An array of string labels or a comma-separated list of string values
A color or an array of colors
A color or an array of colors
A color or an array of colors
A color or an array of colors
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

TimeSeriesChartView.description: Some JavaScript code for custom initialization of the chart.js options - available in the 'chartOptions' variable
Stretch vertically to fill the parent component height
An array of string labels or a comma-separated list of string values
A color or an array of colors
A color or an array of colors
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

TagsView.description: Text for the built in 'Add' button.
Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the 'Add' button
The message when duplicate tags are detected. Set to an empty string to disable the message
Class (or classes) to apply to the new tag input element
Specifies the type of input to use: text, email, tel, url, or number. Default is text
The error message when invalid tags are detected. Set to an empty string to disable the message
The maximum amount of tags that can be added. The limit can still be exceeded if manipulated outside of the component
The message when the limit is reached. Set to an empty string to disable the message
When set, disables adding the tag on the input's keydown.enter event
When set, disables the focus styling of the component root element
When set, the tags will not have a remove button
When set, enables removal of last tag in tags when user presses delete or backspace and the input is empty
Separator character(s) that will trigger a tag to be created (use an array in a formula to support several separators)
Class (or classes) to apply to the tags
Makes the built in tags have a pill appearance
The value of the ARIA label attribute on the remove button in the tag
Label for the aria-live region that announces removed tag(s) to screen reader users
Optional tag validator method. Passed a single argument of tag being added. Should return true if the tag passes validation, or false if the tag cannot be added
Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the tags
A value evaluating to true is required for this control to have a valid state
Number of columns for the label when horizontal layout
Class(es) (space-separated) applying to the label
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

PopoverView.description: When set, the popover must be shown/hidden using the 'show' and 'hide' functions
Configures the event on the target that will trigger the popover. Default is 'click'. You can disable auto-trigger and use regular 'show'/'hide' functions.

DatepickerView.description: Embeds a calendar control directly, without the dropdown picker
If set, stretches the calendar to take the entire available width in the parent
Format object for displayed text string that is passed to Intl.DateTimeFormat. Default is { 'year': 'numeric', 'month': 'long', 'day': 'numeric', 'weekday': 'long' }

When the data model is not defined, sets the initial calendar month date that will be presented to the user. Accepts a value in YYYY-MM-DD format or a Date object. Defaults to the current date (or min or max if the current date is out of range)
A function that takes the date and returns HTML code to be placed in the corresponding calendar cell, for example: date => `${moment(date).format('DD')}`
Number of columns for the label when horizontal layout (0 or undefined is auto)
When placed in a form container, the value must be defined when submitting the form
When set, shows the optional 'reset' button
When the optional reset button is clicked, the selected date will be set to this value. Default is to clear the selected value
When set, shows the optional 'select today' button
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

TimepickerView.description: Embeds a calendar control directly, without the dropdown picker
Number of columns for the label when horizontal layout (0 or undefined is auto)
When placed in a form container, the value must be defined when submitting the form
When set, shows the optional 'reset' button
When the optional 'reset' button is clicked, the selected date will be set to this value. Default is to clear the selected value
When set, shows the optional 'select now' button
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

PaginationView.description: The initial page when this component is shown the first time (starting at 1)
Hides the goto first and goto last page buttons
Hides the goto first and goto last page buttons
Content to place in the goto first page button. Default value is '«'
Content to place in the goto previous page button. Default value is '‹'
Content to place in the goto next page button. Default value is '›'
Content to place in the goto last page button. Default value is '»'
Content to place in the ellipsis placeholder. Default value is '…'

AvatarView.description: Value to place in the alt attribute for image and icon avatars
Set to a string for content in the badge (empty string shows an empty badge)
When checked places the badge at the left instead of the right
CSS length to offset the badge. Positive values move the badge inwards, while negative values move the badge outwards
When checked places the badge at the top instead of the bottom
Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the badge
When set to true, renders the avatar as a button
Type of button to render (i.e. button, submit, reset). Has no effect if prop button is not set
Icon name to use for the avatar. Must be all lowercase. Defaults to person-fill if text or src props not provided
Specifies the type of rounding to apply to the avatar. The square prop takes precedence
Disables rounding of the avatar, rending the avatar with square corners
Image URL to use for the avatar
Text to place in the avatar
Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the component
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

EmbedView.description: A URL or formula evaluating to a URL that will override the data model (if not defined, the data model is expected to contain an URL)
The aspect ratio of the responsive embed
Controls should be displayed (such as a play/pause button, etc)
Content will start playing as soon as it is ready
Content will start over again, every time it is finished
The audio output of the video should be muted
An image to be shown while the video is downloading, or until the user hits the play button
Specify if and how the content should be loaded when the page loads (warning: to be avoided for eco-design)
Sets the outer element tag which the responsive embed is wrapped in (default is div) to enforce the responsive aspect ratio.
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

MapView.description: Map titles server URL, default is "https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png" (see the leaflet doc to change URL)
A list of marker definitions (to be shown on the map). Definitions include the following fields: latlng (mandatory), disablePopup, popupHtml, iconUrl, iconSize, iconAnchor, html.
Disable all user interactions with the map (zoom, move, keyboard, ...)
A coordinates object (e.g. [lat, lng] or {lat: x, lng: y})

CarouselView.description: A CSS style to be applied to slides
A CSS class to be applied to slides
Enforce size ratio for blank slides
Enforce size ratio for blank slides
Set the CSS color of the carousel's background
Make the slide show look like a video to be played - paused by clicking on the slide show
Enable the previous and next controls
When set, changes the slide animation to a crossfade instead of a sliding effect
Enable the indicator buttons for jumping to specific slides
Set the delay time (in milliseconds) between slides, 0 means paused auto sliding
Slide show is intially paused and needs to be started manually
Stop the slide animations while in edit mode
When set, disables animation when transitioning between slides
When set, disables the pausing of the slide show when the current slide is hovered
Do not restart the slide show when then end is reached
Disable controlling the slides via touch swipes

When set, overrides the slides configuration with the data model (must be a list of slide descriptors or strings containing the URL of the images). Valid properties for slide descriptors are: imgSrc (image URL), captionHtml, textHtml, background, imgBlank, imgBlankColor. If the data is a list of strings, these strings are used as imgSrc properties.
Sets the prefix for the ARIA label on the slide indicator controls. Will be suffixed with the slide number (1 indexed)
Sets the ARIA label on the indicator controls wrapper
Sets the ARIA label value for the next slide control
Sets the ARIA label value for the previous slide control

ProgressView.description: Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the component
The number of digits after the decimal to round the value to
Override the default height by specifying a CSS height value (including units)
Enable the animated background. Also automatically set 'striped'
Tune the text to be displayed on the progress bar
Number of columns for the label when horizontal layout (0 or undefined is auto)
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)

NavbarView.description: When set, a fade-in transition animation will show at the indicated duration (for instance, 1s or 100ms)
The default toaster to be used when calling $tools.toast(...) without specifying a toaster
Set to top for fixed to the top of the viewport, or bottom for fixed to the bottom of the viewport
Tell when to collapse the menu items in a toggleable burger menu (default is md)
Show the default locale selector, which uses the i18n entries to determine the supported locales

Internationalization resources as an object containing a key-value resource object for each supported locale. All supported locales will be shown in the locale selector. For instance: { 'en-GB': { key1: 'en-value1', key2: 'en-value2' }, 'fr-FR': { key1: 'fr-value1', ... } }
Strech the menu items to fill the available space in this nav bar
Set to true to make the navbar stick to the top of the viewport (or parent container that has 'position: relative' set) when scrolled
Applies a vertical layout
Sets the main navbar to the end of the root container (bottom or right if vertical layout is selected)
How top-level items are shown to the user
When unset, defaults to dark; use custom to allow for custom CSS
Control the text color by setting to light for use with light background color variants, or dark for dark background color variants; use custom to allow custom CSS
Show the logged user avatar in the navbar (note that the default profile dialog can be overridden by setting a custom action in the onShowUserProfile property)
Show the button to switch edit mode on
Hide the action in the user's menu to show/edit the user's profile
An action to be evaluated when the user asks for opening the user profile
Use a custom authentication for this app rather than the builtin one
The code that will be executed to login (on success should call setUserProfile(userProfile) on this navbar).
The code that will be executed to logout (on success should call setUserProfile(undefined) in this navbar).
The user avatar URL (if not defined, falls back to the built-in profile image URL)
Show the impersonate action in the user menu (for administration purpose only)
Always hide the user email in the navbar (next to the avatar)
When checked and user is not signed in, automatically redirects to the page with the login id and hides this navbar
Show a button to open the resource monitoring popup
Show a custom user-editable component in the navbar
Show the sync button in the navbar (only when logged in)
Synchronize all data when the current route/page changes
When checked, the application content will switch to 'infinite scroll mode'
Select the page id to fallback to when the given route is undefined or not found (if not set, the default page is index)
A function to filter or generate menu items dynamically, for example: items => $tools.arrayConcat(items, { label: "My page", kind: "Page", pageId: "myPage" })
Application global initialization can be defined here and will be accessible with the config variable
Class(es) for the brand image.
Style for the brand image. Default is height: 1.5rem;.

common-properties.description: Generate an anchor for visible components (to be used as navigation points in links or in menus)
Some JavaScript code to initialize the this component (for advanced users)
A functional expression that maps (transforms, filters, sorts, reduces, ...) the data from the data source to the data model. For example: dataSource => transform(dataSource)
Class(es) (space-separated) to configure the appearance or layout of the component (see the doc)
Class(es) (space-separated) to configure the appearance or layout of the component container
CSS to configure the appearance or layout of the component container
If undefined, the data model will be initialized with this default value
The data type expected by this component (if the actual data is not compatible, it may raise non-blocking typing errors)
The data multiplicity (if undefined, it is a 0-1 mutiplicity)
If a value other than none is selected, the component will be resizable against the given direction(s)
An expression that should return true if dropping the given data is allowed on the current component
When checked, the @intersect event is fired whenever the component intersection with the viewport changes (enters/leaves)
An animation to apply to this component when revealed to the user (when entering the viewport)
When once is selected, the component is animated only the first time it appears
The identifier of the field in the data source (only if the data source is an object)
